title: R44325
content: The level of pay for congressional staff is determined by the chair and ranking Member of Senate committees, who set job titles, pay rates, and resources. Congressional pay data is of interest for assessing costs, setting pay levels, and comparing with other federal government systems. The report provides information on congressional staff pay levels, including minimum and maximum levels, resources available, and data sourced from official Senate reports. This data is valuable for assessing costs, setting pay levels, and comparing with other federal government systems. The report is based on official Senate reports, providing data on congressional staff pay levels and compensation. The information is sourced from the Senate's Report of the Secretary of the Senate, published semiannually, and organized by LegiStorm. Annual data by fiscal year is also included for analysis of Senate committee staff compensation. The report, based on official Senate reports, provides data on congressional staff pay levels sourced from the Secretary of the Senate. It includes pay data for 13 staff positions in Senate committees since FY2001. The report presents pay data for 13 staff positions in Senate committees since FY2001, based on official Senate reports. Position titles were identified through a two-step process, with 12 titles used by six or fewer panels. In FY2014, 302 job titles in Senate committees were identified, with 277 titles filled by only one staff member excluded. The remaining 25 titles were assessed for staff employment across 20 Senate committees. Twelve titles used by six or fewer panels were excluded, and pay data was collected for the remaining 13 positions. For the Senate committees, data was collected for no more than two staff per committee with the same job title. All payments to staff for the fiscal year were tabulated, including overtime and bonuses. Pay data for House committee staff can be found in a separate report. Data collected for this report includes pay information for congressional staff, which may include overtime, bonuses, and other payments in addition to base salary. Pay data for staff in House committee offices can be found in CRS Report R44322, while data for staff in Senators' and House Members' personal offices can be found in CRS Report R44324 and CRS Report R44323 respectively. Pay Levels for Selected Positions in House Committees, 2001-2014 are available in CRS Report R44323. Older Senate Handbook notes that individuals with the same job title may perform vastly different duties. Acknowledging the imprecision in congressional job titles, differences in duties for similarly titled staff can impact their pay levels.
